page.title: 03FARMING:DARTMOUTH ESTATES.
page.content: The land is mainly good grassland pasture and is currently worth between Â£1000-Â£1200 an acre with vacant possession.Land values have fallen recently.Lord Dartmouth does not sell his land but re-allocates it to his larger tenants when tenancies are not renewed due to a farmer retiring or selling his farmhouse to a third party.Six farms are being built up in this way for only the larger efficient farmers can make a worthwhile living. The largest farm is around 230 acres. It costs about Â£85 an acre annually to keep the land in good condition.Sprays,fertilizers and careful cultivation are needed or the land will quickly revert back to rough grazing.The upper moorland ridges have hungry,acidic soil and they are not likely to be used for stock-bearing in the foreseeable future.
